column4: hi all , does anyone know how do i use wget to download a web page source code into text file?
ï»¿hi all , does anyone know how do i use wget to download a web page source code into text file?
wget www.google.se will save the html in the current folder
its source code?
it's the html code
it won't be source code if the page is generated using php or such
thanks
Its me again. i need that wget will do the same thing as i go view-> view web page source
it does
no . when i do view->view web page source it prints the current html source. when i do wget "address" it generates a new html file contains different thing.

ok, try this... I'll pick a swedish site for testing.. sunet is the swedish university network.. run this in a terminal "wget www.sunet.se -O source.html && gedit source.html", go the http://www.sunet.se in firefox, look at the source code..
on my computer they look the same
i forgot to bound the address with " ".
thanks alot
you're welcome
check the specifications.... I'm not sure if there is a software way to do it
Where can i see it in /proc/cpuinfo
I have no idea
I see clflush size : 64
perhaps "address sizes"
http://www.linuxweblog.com/node/555
here's another article http://www.cyberciti.biz/faq/linux-how-to-find-if-processor-is-64-bit-or-not/
Thank u
thanks , so "lm" represents "long mode" so if you grep flags /proc/cpuinfo and u see in the flags colums the flag "lm" it is 64
